title: Killer babysitter who said 'I'm innocent' finally admits killing tiny baby
text:
Samantha Klein, left, admitted killing three month-old Alaya Foster on Tuesday – seven months after insisting she was innocent of any wrongdoing, and that the little girl had just died suddenly while in Klein’s care

A babysitter who proclaimed: ‘I’m innocent’ after a baby girl died in her care has admitted shaking the infant until her spine was damaged.

Samantha Klein, 31, admitted the February 2019 manslaughter of Alaya Foster at a plea hearing Tuesday after the youngster’s death by blunt force trauma.

Alaya, who was three-and-a-half months old when she died in Niagara Falls, New York, was shaken to her death by Klein at the killer’s home.

That attack was so ferocious it caused the youngster to suffer a brain bleed, fractured skull and spinal cord damage.

Klein, who was originally charged with murder in August, offered no excuse for the attack, and did not say what had provoked her into killing Alaya.

Three weeks after the baby’s death, she went on TV to protest her innocence and declared: ‘I did nothing to that baby.’

She claimed Alaya had a bruise when she was dropped off, and that the youngster had suddenly passed out and gone cold.

Alaya was dropped off with Klein by her mother Dominique Hilson, who texted Klein the next day asking when she was bringing Alaya back home.

Chillingly, Klein ignored the question and responded by saying that Alaya was fine, before offering to watch her for another evening.

The youngster’s lifeless body was brought to hospital later that night.

Klein faces up to 25 years in jail over Alaya’s death, the Niagara Gazette reported.

She could also face a further 17 and a half years in jail after admitting separate crimes of robbery and selling fentanyl to a police officer.

Both sentences will run concurrently, with Klein set to learn how long she will spend behind bars on December 3.
